intro: Souroubea crassipes var. didyma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant purple or blue flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. This variety is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
